ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ sagánò, ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ gie á ne ńzẅíʼte shwóŋè yé ngie:
en: Once more Jesus spoke to them in parables:

ngiemboon: «Pi gyá páʼ lefùɔ Ssé ée púʼu. Atsɔ̌ fùɔ lǎʼ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ̀ɔn na nò lɔ́ɔnndá míŋ we wembàŋa,
en: “The kingdom of heaven    is like a king who gave a wedding banquet for his son.   # 22:2 Mt 13:24; Lk 12:36; Jn 2:2; Rv 19:7

ngiemboon: ńtúm mentsìndá pé, ngie pɔ́ gʉa faʼ pʉ̀a pie à ka tsẅii mbwó pɔ́b páʼ pɔ́ ge tó pâ pɔ̌ pfɛ́ shúm. Táʼ mentsìndá pé gʉa ńgyá wɛ̌ nyìŋ na pɔ́b wɔ́, á lʉʼ lʉʼ létó.
en: He sent his servants to summon those invited to the banquet,    but they didn’t want to come.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńtúm petsɔ́ mentsìndá pé, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie: “Pi gɔɔn né pʉ̀a pie n ka tóŋo wɔ́b ngie mé cwoŋté shúm léjÿó tà ńtÿɔ́gɔ ssé ngie n tsẅǐ mé zẅé mefòŋ pɔ́ɔn, ńzẅé menɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ɔn pie é fáŋ tɛʼ, ngie shúm ně ndáʼ ńtyé ssé, pɔ́ tó mé jÿó línɔ̀ɔn lɔ́ɔnndá!”
en: Again, he sent out other servants and said, ‘Tell those who are invited: See, I’ve prepared my dinner; my oxen and fattened cattle have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, epʉ̀a pie mé ka tóŋo wɔ́b na línɔ̀ɔn lɔ́ɔnndá té lɔgɔ nò gie pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, pfó pɔ́ ye nzsè. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gʉa né nkáʼ yé, wetsɔ̌ gee ńtáŋ metʉ̌a we.
en: “But they paid no attention and went away, one to his own farm, another to his business,

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ gwoon mentsìndá fùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgege wɔ́b, ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: while the rest seized his servants, mistreated them, and killed them.

ngiemboon: Anò pú ḿbÿɔ́gɔ fùɔ. Á túm palÿɔ́ʼncù pé, ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńzẅéte mefÿɛ́ apɛ̌, ńtuɔ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b,
en: The king    was enraged, and he sent out his troops, killed those murderers, and burned down their city.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńtsẅi né mentsìndá pé ngie: “Mé ně ńdáʼ ńtÿɔ́g shúm léjÿó lɔ́ɔnndá ssé. Epʉ̀a pie n ka zɔɔn ńtóŋo wɔ́b, é ka te pie é kuʼu lépfɛ́ wɔ́.
en: “Then he told his servants, ‘The banquet is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńgʉa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn na metwó nzsè, ńgyá mbɔɔ wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, pi tóŋo yé tóŋ.”
en: Go then to where the roads exit the city and invite everyone you find to the banquet.’

ngiemboon: Mentsìndá pé pa gʉa, ńtyé na metwó nzsè, ńgyá wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ, ńtóŋo yé, kà à gwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ mbòŋo wɔ́ɔ, kà nyìŋ tepòŋ wɔ́ɔ. Mé pú ńnéŋe wɔ́b pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá lemù, tà é lúe.
en: So those servants went out on the roads and gathered everyone they found, both evil and good. The wedding banquet was filled with guests.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ gÿo ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ndá lemù légyá láʼ gie á tǒ na lɔ́ɔnndá, ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa, mbà à kaa nzsǒ lɔ́ɔnndá maʼa.
en: When the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who was not dressed for a wedding.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né yé ngie: “Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gÿǒ lêkɔ́ ńkúu jʉʼɔɔn té maʼ nzsǒ lɔ́ɔnndá?” Nyìŋ awɛ̌ te zsé nò gie à ge gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: So he said to him, ‘Friend,    how did you get in here without wedding clothes? ’ The man was speechless.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó mentsìndá pé ngie: “Pi kwɛ́ mekwò mé, ńkwɛ́ mbwó mé, ḿmaʼa yé pǐ, á tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm. À ge néŋe jʉʼó, é ne lʉa, lóŋ we ne ffó.”
en: “Then the king told the attendants, ‘Tie him up hand and foot,    and throw him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ngie: Áa púʼu nue e Ssé ne ńtóŋo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, táʼ, epʉ̀a pie à ge tsɔ́ʼ é té gyɔ́ɔn.»
en: “For many are invited, but few are chosen.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Falísáyè gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgÿo cúʼtè, éfaʼ páʼ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fó na nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn, ńgwoon yé.
en: Then the Pharisees went and plotted how to trap him by what he said.  ,# 22:15–22 Mk 12:13–17; Lk 20:20–26

ngiemboon: Ńtúm tsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a na ngàŋakwò yɔ́b, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a na kwò pʉ̀a Elônde ngie pɔ́ gʉa, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Tsítsà, peg ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ gɔɔn nò, ḿbiŋ ńdaʼte pɔ́ nò gie á tyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, ńgɔɔn té pɔ́gɔ nyìŋ, mélàʼmie ɔ̀ te líe nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ na shÿó wɔ́, ńdaʼte nò nénʉ́ pɔ́ páʼ Ssé ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo púʼu.
en: So they sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians.   “Teacher,” they said, “we know that you are truthful and teach truthfully the way of God. You don’t care what anyone thinks nor do you show partiality.  # 22:16 Lit don’t look on the face of men,# 22:16 Jn 3:2; Ac 10:34; 13:10; 18:26

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég páʼ ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú na yɔɔn nò: Lepʉ̌ ségè ée péʼe ńzẅíŋ ngie pege maʼ ncùb Kásà pà Loma kà ngǎŋ?»
en: Tell us, then, what you think. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar   or not? ”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá tepòŋ wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pankwoŋmenÿɔ́g, pi kwaʼte wɔ́ɔn mélàʼakɔ́?
en: Perceiving their malicious intent, Jesus said, “Why are you testing me, hypocrites?

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn nkáb gie mé lɔgɔ ńnáa ncùb. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pàga nkáb ńtó, ńnyɛɛ yé.»
en: Show me the coin used for the tax.” They brought him a denarius.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ́ gẅie ée na nkáb? Sɔɔn gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ?»
en: “Whose image and inscription is this? ” he asked them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ée we Kásà, lezíŋ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ sé.» Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ púʼu, pi náa mmó gie áa yé Kásà, á mbwó Kásà, ńnáa ye Ssé á mbwó Ssé.»
en: “Caesar’s,” they said to him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼ páʼ à tsɔ̌ʼ púʼu, á cʉa wɔ́b. Pɔ́ nyé yé jʉʼó, ńgʉa.
en: When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼo, etsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a na nùɔ pà Sandúkaye leen ńké ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô. Pa Sandúkaye ée pʉ̀a pie é té zẅíŋ ngie mepfó ge gÿo zíme na legwé wɔ́. Pɔ́ zɛ́te mbwó Yěsô ngie:
en: That same day some Sadducees,   who say there is no resurrection, came up to him and questioned him:  # 22:23 Mt 3:7; Ac 4:1; 23:8

ngiemboon: «Tsítsà, Mǒonsê la gɔɔn ngie: “Nyìŋ mbàŋa lɔɔn ńzɔ́ʼɔ manzwě, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbà fɛ̌ we gẅiin lésɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g, pɔ́ yé zyé penkʉ́, ńdɔg ńnuŋe ngẅɛ̀ fɛ̌ we.”
en: “Teacher, Moses said, if a man dies, having no children, his brother is to marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.   ,# 22:24 Dt 25:5

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, etsɔ́ mefɛ̌ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ndùŋmvfò zɔ́ʼ, ńkwé té cʉa mmó, mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé té cʉa mmó,
en: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first got married and died. Having no offspring, he left his wife to his brother.

ngiemboon: mbɔ́ɔntè yétá gíŋe sɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g wa, ńkwé pɔ́ te cʉa mmó, pɔ́ púʼu, tà pɔ́b sɔɔnmbʉ́a pú ńzɔ́ʼɔ wɛ̌ manzwě, ńké ńkwé pɔ́ te cʉa mmó.
en: The same thing happened to the second also, and the third, and so on to all seven.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zsote, manzwě kwé yé.
en: Last of all, the woman died.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pʉ̀a pɔɔn sɔɔnmbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́ʼɔ manzwě wɔɔn ŋwɛ́ lɔɔn, mé ge láʼ zíme na legwé, à gwɔ́ nzwě wɔ́?»
en: In the resurrection, then, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had married her.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Legye sí ne fʉʉ gẅí, á nue pi te mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé zsé, ḿbiŋ ńké te zsé páʼ metʉ̀ Ssé ée púʼu wɔ́.
en: Jesus answered them, “You are mistaken, because you don’t know the Scriptures or the power of God.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mé ge láʼ zíme na legwé, mbàŋa mbɔɔ panzwě le gíŋe ńzɔ́ʼ wɔ́. Pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé pie ée tÿǒ lepwó,
en: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage but are like    angels in heaven.   # 22:30 Mt 24:38; Lk 17:27

ngiemboon: ńgʉa na mepfó páʼ pɔ́ ge gÿo zím, mbà pi laa fó ńtóŋo mmó gie Ssé la gɔɔn wɔ́ ka? À la te gɔɔn ngie:
en: Now concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven’t you read what was spoken to you by God:

ngiemboon: “Mèŋ n gee Ssé Ábalaham, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Ésàg, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Yakwɔ̂b wa?#22:32 Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pʉ̀a Ssé pɔɔn pie é la láʼ ńkwé, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, pâ Ssé gwɔ́.” Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: “E Ssé e te Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, ee Ssé pʉ̀a pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.”»
en: I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?   ,# 22:32 Ex 3:6,15–16 He   # 22:32 Other mss read God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”

ngiemboon: Menùɔ láʼ mie é laa jʉʼó la ne ńgɔʼte ntí gie Yěsô lɔgɔ ńzíʼi pʉ̀a mmó púʼu.
en: And when the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Falísáyè gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ páʼ Yěsô jÿɔ̌ʼ ncwò pʉ̀a Sandúkaye, ḿbú ńcúʼte lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: When   the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they came together.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé tó ńkwaʼte Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: And one of them, an expert in the law, asked a question to test him:

ngiemboon: «Tsítsà, áa na mbʉ̌ péʼe, sɛ̌ gwɔ́ sé lÿò?»
en: “Teacher, which command in the law is the greatest? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «“Kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gú ntsèm, né zẅìge jú ntsèm mbɔɔ né zsénò jú ntsèm.”
en: He said to him, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.   ,# 22:37 Dt 6:5; Lk 10:27

ngiemboon: Ée lepʉ̌ selÿò, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋmvfò.
en: This is the greatest and most important    command.

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a sie é sẅé sɔɔn gwɔ́ ngie: “Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ páʼ twó mbùm jú.”
en: The second is like it: Love your neighbor as yourself.   ,# 22:39 Lv 19:18; Mt 19:19

ngiemboon: Mbʉ̌ Mǒonsê ntsèm mbɔɔ menò mie pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn, éfóo pɔ́ na mbʉ̌ mɔɔn mémbʉ́a.»
en: All the Law and the Prophets depend    on these two commands.”   # 22:40 Mt 7:12; Rm 13:8–10; Gl 5:14

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Falísáyè gwɔ́ tà ńcúʼte, Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: While the Pharisees were together, Jesus questioned them,

ngiemboon: «Pi kwǎŋ gí ngie Nzàʼnkÿo aa wɔ̌? Ngie aa míŋ wɔ̌?» Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Aa nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavîd.»
en: “What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he? ”

ngiemboon: «Á piŋ ngǎ, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la jÿó fùɔ Ndavîd, á tóŋo yé lê “Ndè,”
en: He asked them, “How is it then that David, inspired by the Spirit,    calls him ‘Lord’   # 22:43 2Sm 23:2; Rv 1:10; 4:2:

ngiemboon: tà ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: The Lord declared to my Lord,

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavîd lɔ̌ɔn ńtóŋo yé lê we “Ndè” páʼɔɔn, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ we lêkɔ́?»
en: “If David calls him ‘Lord,’ how, then, can he be his son? ”

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pafalísáyè, nyìŋ te kuʼu léfó ńtsɔ́ʼ pɔ́ tàʼa nò na nò gie Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́. Á fó lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́ nyìŋ te gíŋe, ńgẅiin shÿɔg, lézɛ́te yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: No one was able to answer him at all,   and from that day no one dared to question him anymore.  # 22:46 Mk 12:34; Lk 14:6; 20:40
